You dont even have to point it at the tv now. Would recommend this so much I bought a few for family members for Christmas.
author: Robert Bell

review: There are times this won't connect with the bundled remote control. That requires a reboot which takes 3-5 minutes. I've also had to hard reset this which means instead of chilling out and watching some TV, you spend about 30 minutes performing tech support and restoring the Roku settings and your channels/subscriptions.On top of that they have nonsensical status updates like "Releasing gravity locks" and "maximizing fun factor" (which should really read "Working on getting you frustrated"). Really? First of all the product doesn't work as advertised and then they have these stupid update messages on the screen. Roku, get quality engineers as well as a copy writer.And yeah, the odd chance this actually works, you'll be wasting time checking out the loading screen.But it's consistent; no matter what happens, you will be wasting your time. If you want to watch TV, get an Apple TV or Amazon FireTV or something else.
author: Sid S

review: I bought this for a spare TV in our home office. The price for the Roku is certainly cheaper than the monthly fee for another cable box. It works just fine. It is a little slower to change between apps and shows than the Roku HD we have upstairs. I haven't had any disconnection problems and streaming is uninterrupted. The only con I have is that the remote that came with this refurbished unit was covered with sticky fingerprints. It cleaned up fine but it was kind of gross.
